title: shrtcts
text: shrtcts recognizes following roxygen tags. Tags optional unless otherwise specified. @title (required): name shortcut’s addin RStudio. tag required, first line untagged text (#' Say Something Nice ) interpreted title. function, either exported another package, e.g. praise::praise anonymous named function provided immediately roxygen2 comments section. (Function names ignored provided). @description: description shortcut. Can specified roxygen tag can first paragraph untagged text title line. @interactive: Whether shortcut’s addin executed interactively. Non-interactive addins run background, without alerting user without providing mechanism user cancel function. shortcut interactive calls function stored another package, code execute function displayed console, rather placeholder shortcut shrtcts. @id: integer id (< 100) used link shortcut specific placeholder function shrtcts. example, #' @id 5 link provided shortcut shrtcts:::shortcut_05(). particularly useful keyboard shortcut linked shortcut, although need tag mitigated @shortcut tag. @shortcut: combination keys used keyboard shortcut RStudio. Keyboard shortcuts applied set_keyboard_shortcuts set calling add_rstudio_shortcuts(). option disabled default.

title: shrtcts
text: Run add_rstudio_shortcuts() install shortcuts. ’ll need restart R session RStudio learn shortcuts. also update shrtcts-related keyboard shortcuts, set set_keyboard_shortcuts = TRUE. update keyboard shortcuts stored RStudio’s addins.json, typically stored ~/.config/rstudio/keybindings (>= 1.3) ~/.R/rstudio/keybindings (< 1.3). file stored non-standard location setup, can provide set_keyboard_shortcuts correct path addins.json. title: shrtcts
text: can use @shortcut tag declare shortcut .shrtcts.R (shortcut: YAML .shrtcts.yml). update keyboard shortcuts (shrtcts !), set set_keyboard_shortcuts = TRUE calling add_rstudio_shortcuts(). use method, shortcuts set manually RStudio overwritten, choose one method . .shrtcts.R .shrtcts.yml full restart RStudio required whenever shrtcts udpates shortcut keybindings. shrtcts manages keybindings addins, doesn’t check conflicting key combinations, may want double check RStudio menu. anything goes wrong, backup keybindings saved addins.json.bak folder addins.json found. title: shrtcts
text: shrtcts initially provided way specify shortcuts YAML file. made sense everything YAML days, add yet another YAML config file mix? writing R code inside YAML , um, less ideal. ’s longer recommended, still supported (now). convert existing shortcuts YAML roxygen2 format, use internal shrtcts:::migrate_yaml2r() function. Use following template organize .shrtcts.yaml. shortcut YAML list item following structure:
code: - Name: Make A Noise   Description: Play a short sound   Binding: beepr::beep   Interactive: true   id: 42   shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+B

title: shrtcts
text: shrtcts inspired rsam, RStudio Addins Manager @yonicd. ’s lot rsam can — including helping manage keyboard shortcuts — shrtcts essentially extension rsam’s limited liability addins. rsam provides three slots custom addins turn look specially-named functions defined global environment. addins menu, three custom addins appear lla1, lla2, lla3. upside rsam don’t write code YAML (huge plus!), downside names addins fixed. shrtcts, hand, rewrites addin registry can customized addin names descriptions. packages, number custom addins limited: rsam provides 3 slots, shrtcts gives 100.

what: Get and run shortcuts by name — shortcut_run
title: Get and run shortcuts by name — shortcut_run
text: using .R file store shortcuts, shortcuts use named functions, can get run shortcut functions helpers. example, ~/.shrtcts.R file includes cow_say_praise() function   can use   run shortcut, can use   get shortcut function run . helper functions, ~/.shrtcts.R file portable becomes place can store utility workflow functions.
code: # ~/.shrtcts.R  praise <- function() {   # your shortcuts, when run this way, can reference other functions   praise::praise() }  #' Have a cow say something nice cow_say_praise <- function() {   cowsay::say(praise()) } shortcut_run("cow_say_praise") happy_cow <- shortcut_get("cow_say_praise")

title: Get and run shortcuts by name — shortcut_run
text: shortcut_run() enables use shortcuts Positron. can assign keyboard shortcut specific shortcut function running Preferences: Open Default Keyboard Shortcuts (JSON) command. add entry like following:   press Cmd + K followed Cmd + P, Positron run cow_say_praise shortcut R console. Replace workbench.action.executeCode.console workbench.action.executeCode.silently run shortcut silently background. can also use "" key control keyboard shortcut valid, e.g. "": "editorTextFocus".
code: {   "key": "cmd+k cmd+p",   "name": "Have a cow say something nice",   "command": "workbench.action.executeCode.console",   "args": {     "langId": "r",     "code": "shrtcts::shortcut_run('cow_say_praise')",     "focus": true   } },

title: Get and run shortcuts by name — shortcut_run
text: .name Name function shortcut (roxygen2 comments name function assigned). ... Additional arguments passed shortcut function run. .path_shortcuts path .shrcts.R file. Must R script; YAML shortcuts syntax supported.

title: Get and run shortcuts by name — shortcut_run
text: shortcut_run(): Run shortcut assigned name shortcut_get(): Get shortcut assigned name

title: Get and run shortcuts by name — shortcut_run
code: # Create a small example .shrtcts.R file. set.seed(42) tmp_shortcuts <- tempfile(fileext = ".R") writeLines(" praise <- function() {   # your shortcuts, when run this way, can reference other functions   praise::praise() }  #' Have a cow say something nice cow_say_praise <- function() {   cowsay::say(praise()) } ", tmp_shortcuts)  # Run the `cow_say_praise` shortcut by name shortcut_run("cow_say_praise", .path_shortcuts = tmp_shortcuts) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘cowsay’  # Get the `cow_say_praise` shortcut cow_praise <- shortcut_get("cow_say_praise", tmp_shortcuts) cow_praise() #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘cowsay’
